channel.title: Java Teacher
channel.description: Here's the gist. There's probably been a million of these, but the difference is I'm serious. I am looking for somebody to teach me Java. I have ADHD, and it is hard for me to sit there, and concentrate on tutorials. I need live help and instruction. I am a pretty fast learner, and I am willing to work hard and practice. I am willing to pay. Please pm me with your prices, or post here. Also if you have any questions feel free to do either.

item.title: Java Teacher
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

If you’re in college already, just wait till the next semester to take a college class. Getting a private tutor can be more expensive. When it comes to piano teaching at college, you can take an entire class for around $400 (depends), but private lessons can cost up to $40 dollars an hour.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Teacher
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

Notorious Sanch:

Here’s the gist. There’s probably been a million of these, but the difference is I’m serious. I am looking for somebody to teach me Java. I have ADHD, and it is hard for me to sit there, and concentrate on tutorials. I need live help and instruction. I am a pretty fast learner, and I am willing to work hard and practice. I am willing to pay. Please pm me with your prices, or post here. Also if you have any questions feel free to do either.

I’ve managed to cope fine despite my ADHD. Stick to videos and take it slow. If interest starts to decrease in a session, stop and pick it up another time.
You don’t need a paid teacher.
However, mentors are rather useful.

Read full topic
